title: Remote point
summary: In general topology, a remote point is a point p {\displaystyle p} that belongs to the Stone–Čech compactification β X {\displaystyle \beta X} of a Tychonoff space X {\displaystyle X} but that does not belong to the topological closure within β X {\displaystyle \beta X} of any nowhere dense subset of X {\displaystyle X} .[1]
